That's a great idea! Taking extra classes or workshops focused on performance technique and stage presence can be super helpful in building your confidence and skills. It's a wonderful way to address your concerns and prepare yourself for the recital.

In fact, many dance studios offer specialized classes or workshops on performance technique, stage presence, and audition prep. These classes can help you work on specific areas such as:

* Developing a strong stage presence and confidence
* Improving your ability to connect with the audience
* Refining your performance quality and expression
* Mastering the art of performing in front of an audience
* Learning how to handle nerves and performance anxiety

Additionally, taking extra classes can also help you:

* Get more comfortable with the studio's performance style and expectations
* Receive personalized feedback and guidance from instructors
* Meet other dancers who may be performing in the recital, which can help you feel more connected and supported

I would definitely recommend taking advantage of these opportunities to improve your performance skills and build your confidence. You can ask your studio about any upcoming workshops or classes that might be available, or search online for other local dance studios or schools that offer similar programs.

Remember, the more you prepare and work on your skills, the more confident you'll feel on stage. And who knows, you might even discover a new passion for performing!

How does that sound? Are you going to look into taking some extra classes or workshops?
